meanings.definition: To form a defensive circle of vehicles or wagons.
meanings.sent1: The pioneers were laagering their wagons for protection.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers laagered their vehicles to defend against the enemy.
meanings.sent3: The family decided to laager their cars in the parking lot to keep them safe from theft.
meanings.sent4: The team laagered their equipment in a tight circle to shield it from the storm.
meanings.sent5: The travelers quickly began laagering their belongings to guard against any potential danger.

meanings.definition: The act of forming a defensive circle of vehicles or wagons.
meanings.sent1: The laagering of the wagons was a common practice during the frontier days.
meanings.sent2: The laagering of the vehicles provided a sense of security for the group.
meanings.sent3: The children found it amusing to pretend they were laagering their toy cars in a circle.
meanings.sent4: The laagering of the wagons symbolized unity and protection for the travelers.
meanings.sent5: The intricate laagering of the wagons was a sight to behold, showcasing their defensive strategy.
